attributes.action: No mp pay rises until nurses get a significant pay rise
attributes.additional_details: Our nurses can't survive on claps and well wishes. Pay them what they deserve. We're tired of lip service for our NHS workers while our members of Parliament are happy to take a 3k payrise.  These workers are the backbone of our society not you.
attributes.background: The MP'S latest pay rise should be refused until a significant pay rise is agreed for our nurses.

rejection.details:
The UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for setting MPs' pay. The Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority (IPSA) is responsible for deciding on MPs' expenses and pay. IPSA is independent of both Parliament and Government.

You can find out more about IPSA here: https://www.theipsa.org.uk/about-us/

You may wish to sign these petitions relating to NHS pay and other forms of reward: 
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/316307
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/313488
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/318741
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/313385
